column5: Seem to get answers for about anything here,so heres my question.  Love fresh spring rolls and dipping into peanut sauce. Anyone know how to make or where to buy this peanut sauce?  Thanks

For Peanut Dipping Sauce: 1 small piece of lemon grass, chopped Freshly grated ginger-to taste 1 cup water ½ cup hoisin sauce 3 tablespoons smooth peanut butter 1½ tablespoons sugar  To make the peanut dipping sauce: In a small sauce pan, simmer lemon grass in the water for 5 minutes, strain out the lemongrass and add the remaining ingredients to the water. Whisk well and simmer an additional 5 minutes. If the sauce doesn't thicken, whisk for one minute over medium heat. Pour into individual serving cups and serve with spring rolls.  OH EDIT HERE IS A VIDEO  <iframe width="425" height="349" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/BjZUgKKcAdc" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
Thanks Terry  That was disgusting.Not a peanut sauce I would do or use.  Her spring rolls were no better.
Just make the drive to Salad King on Yonge St Brian... all you gotta do is sit down and order them. No fuss.. no muss !
I make my own rolls Wayne,they are just like any other resturant that makes them. I just cant make the sauce. Im good with a sweet chillie dip,but Betty likes the peanut sauce.
If you can find a Dutch store, check the Indonesian food section. They should have peanut sauce for the satay.
Thanks Jer and thanks to Bruce for the pm. Knew my question would get answered.
It is called pindasauce. Yum, Yum!
Found some HTHM. Theres a Dutch store here in Barrie. Thanks
